lead_paragraph: A cease-fire with the Syrian government puts Kurdish militias much closer to control of Hasaka Province, which would be the third lost by President Bashar al-Assad.

byline.contributor: Maher Samaan contributed reporting from Paris, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus.

headline.print_headline: Kurds Sign Truce With Syrian Government in Northeast, Portending a Shift
headline.main: Kurds Close to Control of Northeast Syria Province, Portending a Shift in the War

snippet: A cease-fire with the Syrian government puts Kurdish militias much closer to control of Hasaka Province, which would be the third lost by President Bashar al-Assad....
abstract: Kurdish militias sign cease-fire with Syrian government, giving them almost total control of northeast province of Hasaka; agreement could shift important alliances in Syrian conflict, including reducing Turkish hostility toward Pres Bashar al-Assad.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
